result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrence T Lafaive was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Terrence T Lafaive was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Terrence T Lafaive is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Terrence T Lafaive was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Schedule IV Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(i).
  • Terrence T Lafaive was found guilty of Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
BAIL APPLIED OF $1500.75. Balance of Fine of $129.75 is to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
BAIL APPLIED. DNA PAID IN FULL.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Inform all doctors of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

Defendant Terrence T Lafaive in court, in custody, with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   Lesli Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing hearing. State presents arguments. Defense presents arguments. Court imposed the following sentence:


AS TO COUNT 2:  IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

4 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 139 days) (State has 7 days to contest any credit)
  -  2 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*inform all doctors of all prescriptions
*Any and all prescriptions to come from the same pharmacy
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
 
FINE or COURT COSTS:  $1630.50 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

APPLY ANY BAIL THAT IS POSTED. 

AS TO COUNT 3:

2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT  
  -  1 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  1 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*inform all doctors of all prescriptions
*Any and all prescriptions to come from the same pharmacy
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on September 7, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Terrence T Lafaive in court, in custody, with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case recalled for continued Jury Trail  @ 09:00 am.
 Parties address the jury instructions.
 Court questions the defendant as to his right to testify.
 Defendant does not wish to testify. Defense rests. 
Jurors enter courtroom @ 09:26 am and court gives instructions to the jurors. 
State presents closing arguments. 
Defense presents closing arguments. 
State presents rebutal arguments. 
Court presents further instructions.
Clerk swears the bailiff.
Jurors leave for deliberations @ 10:37 am
Jurors have reached a verdict @ 1:30 pm.
Jurors reenter the courtroom @ 1:52 pm
Court reads the verdicts.
Jurors have found the the defendant not guilty on count 1
guilty on count 2 Possession with intent to Deliver
and count 3
State moves for judgment on the verdicts
Defense has no position
Court grants and enters Judgment on the verdicts.
State requests bail be revoked. Court grants.
Juror's Selection and Peremptory Challenges
Random Listing Report - Voir Dire

Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Terrence T Lafaive in court, in custody, with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   

Case called for 12 person jury trial. 

State moves to dismiss without prejudice count 3. 
Defense objects and presents arguments. 
Court denied the state's motion. 

Jurors enter the courtroom @ 09:20 am. 
Clerk swears in jurors.  

Court conducts voir dire.  
State conducts voir Dire. 
Defense conducts voir dire. 
Parties conduct strikes. 
Jurors are selected and sworn. 
Balance of jurors are excused at 10:40 am. 

Court takes recess. 
Court reconvened. 

State presents opening statements. 
Defense presents opening statements. 

Officer Darren Wittnebel from the City of Waukesha was sworn and testified on behalf of the state. State presents exhibit #10, marked. Cross examination by the defense. Court breaks for lunch @ 11:45 am. Court reconvened @ 12:50 pm. Officer Chad Pergande from the City of Waukesha was sworn and testified on behalf of the state. State presents exhibit #2, marked. Cross examination by the defense. Redirect by the state. Redirect by the defense. Officer Nathan Smidt from the City of Waukesha was sworn and testified on behalf of the state. State presents exhibits 11, 12, 1, 5 and 6 marked. Court takes recess @ 3:15. Court reconvened @ 3:28 pm.  Cross examination by the defense. Defense presents exhibit #16 marked. Defense presents video not marked. Redirect by the state. 

Defense Marked Exhibit:  17.
Witnesses Called:  Specialist David Platta (City of Waukesha Police Department) and Birjees Kauser (State Crime Lab Analyst).
Witnesses Sworn and testified.

State Rests.
Exhibits 1 - 17 - offered and received.
State's exhibits 2, 10, 11 & 12 and Defense exhibit 16 were published to the jurors.

Jurors excused @ 4:50 pm.
Defense moves to dismiss and presented arguments.
State objects.
Court Denies - Reasons placed on the record.

Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 4:53 pm.
Court addressed the Jurors - Jurors are excused for the evening @ 4:55 pm.
Jurors told to return tomorrow morning @ 9 am.

Court in adjournment for the evening @ 5 pm.
Attorneys told to return tomorrow @ 8:30 am.

Exhibits 10,11 & 12 turned over to the City of Waukesha Police Department for Storage - Will be returned to court tomorrow @ 8:30 am.
